oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Benjamin Franklin Ammons (at right, wearing trews) and Raiford Franklin Ammons (at left) of the 1st Tennessee Heavy Artillery, C.S.A., seated in uniform holding their weapons. Portrait includes letter with narrative.

On June 10, 1864, at the Battle of Brices Crossroads in Mississippi, Raiford Franklin Ammons was shot in the left arm and it was amputated that day. At the time, he was enlisted with the 18th (Newson's) Tennessee Cavalry Regiment [per Mr. Ammons' letter in folder with photograph].
